Detailed Description

Debugging routines.

Allows users to control whether to print DEBUG statements, based on a command line argument.

Define Documentation

#define TOHEX (  x   )     ({ char __x = (x); if(__x < 10) __x+='0'; else __x='a'+(__x-10) ; __x; })
 

Function Documentation

void DEBUG (  char  flag,
char *  format,
  ...
) 
 

Print a debug message, if flag is enabled. Like printf, only with an extra argument on the front.

void DebugInit (  char *  flagList  ) 
 

Initialize so that only DEBUG messages with a flag in flagList will be printed.

If the flag is "+", we enable all DEBUG messages.

Parameters:
flagList is a string of characters for whose DEBUG messages are to be enabled.

bool DebugIsEnabled (  char  flag  ) 
 

Returns:
TRUE if DEBUG messages with "flag" are to be printed.

void DumpMem (  char *  addr,
int  len
) 
 

Prints the raw contents of a memory area, each byte as hex digits

Parameters:
addr the start address of the area (in the host address space)
len the size of the area (in bytes)
